Posted By: BioPrince (1/29/2010 12:23:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ridiculous with [Quest for the Nihil Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quest for the Nihil Stone) and [Megrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Megrim). It's no [Blightning](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blightning), but when you think about it, 2BBB for [Mind Rot](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Rot) slapped onto a 2/2 sounds very nice.  
  
There's better out there, but this thing's a bomb in Limited and it's useful in the aforementioned Nihil Stone.dek to clear the opponent's hand after the Quest goes online when you fire off your Blightning.
posts.html:
Ridiculous with Quest for the Nihil Stone and Megrim. It's no Blightning, but when you think about it, 2BBB for Mind Rot slapped onto a 2/2 sounds very nice.

There's better out there, but this thing's a bomb in Limited and it's useful in the aforementioned Nihil Stone.dek to clear the opponent's hand after the Quest goes online when you fire off your Blightning.

posts.post_content: Too expensive to be usable in a vampire deck. if it's base cost was 2 it might be there, but it's just not fast enough. Much better to use [Mind sludge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind sludge) for 5. you'll probably get at least 4 cards from their hand. for the same cost with this thing you only get 2.

Posted By: Akromar (1/30/2010 12:48:48 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The only new vampire I considder adding to my vampire-control deck. It competes with Mind Sludge, where Mind Sludge is better if the enemy have 5 cards at hand, while this is more reliable as it will have full effect even if my enemy have only a few cards, or I have mana-trouble.  
  
I am undecided, but I like the concept (and great art!)
posts.html:
The only new vampire I considder adding to my vampire-control deck. It competes with Mind Sludge, where Mind Sludge is better if the enemy have 5 cards at hand, while this is more reliable as it will have full effect even if my enemy have only a few cards, or I have mana-trouble.

I am undecided, but I like the concept (and great art!)
Report Abuse  
Posted By: RHS (1/30/2010 3:20:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Man that's some junk. A 2/2 for 3 is horrible these days. And "discard two and get a wimpy 2/2 for 5" is bad too. It's somewhat like [abyssal horror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=abyssal horror). If you want to make your opponent discard two cards, then the horror does the same but has flying for one more mana. The big difference though: if you flicker the horror, or zombify it, or copy it or anything else, it's ability triggers and makes your opponent discard another two. That doesn't work with this vampire.  
That said, abyssal horror is still bad, as is this dude.

posts.post_content: This is basically mind sludge with a vampire attached to it, and most times by the time you drop sludge, your opponent doesn't have more than 3 cards in hand anyways. If your opponent has less cards, you can scale it back and leave mana open. It's fantastic. 4.5/5
